Another great piece of the family. Just as with Opposing Force, I love the different point of view and the sneak peeks at the main events of Black Mesa and the journey of Gordon. It's great.

Half-Life Blue Shift is a fun installment in the Half-Life saga. The level design is good as all Valve games and the story is really good. The only problems I have are that there is no new content like Opposing Force, and the locations you go through in Black Mesa is really boring at times. In all, I would recommend this for people wanting to have fun in Black Mesa in some new locations. 4/5

Pretty short 4 hour campaign, got stuck at a couple of points but the solutions to the puzzles weren't too difficult, only issue I have with this game is the lack of a final boss, pretty underwhelming but it was nice to visit Black Mesa again from a different perspective.

I played half life 2 before this as people said it was optional, and thought this was pretty good. The story isn't vital for half life 2, but it definitely helps, so I would recommend it for that. Overall I would give it a 8/10. It is an older game, so that is the only thing to keep in mind, if you cant handle that, I wouldnt recommend it, otherwise its a fantastic addition to half life.

Questa √® la seconda espansione di Half Life, anche questa sviluppata da GearBox Software.
Non mi dilungher√≤ troppo: Blue Shift FA SCHIFO sotto ogni punto di vista ed √® il peggior Half Life che abbia mai giocato.

La storia, anche qui, √® vista da un altro punto di vista. In questo caso ci troveremo nei panni della guardia Barney Calhoun (importante per lo svolgimento di HL2), anche lui propenso a scappare dalla struttira dopo che l'esperimento √® andato male.
Ora, se OF era serratissimo e divertente con momenti epici quasi al pari del fratello maggiore, BS NON HA NIENTE di tutto ci√≤. Il nostro scopo sar√† quello di trovare il dottor Rosenberg per scappare dalla base. Fine.
Niente colpi di scena, niente situazioni belle, niente eventi particolarmente godibili.
Fa schifo.

L'unica cosa che salvo √® il gameplay, ovviamente, visto che √® preso di pari passo dal primo. Ma anche qui mi scade nello schifo. Se OF inseriva nuove armi e addirittura nuove razze aliene, BS non aggiunge niente di ci√≤ e toglie addirittura molte delle armi di HL.
Dico, almeno lasciate tutte le armi del gioco originale. E invece no, sono pure di meno.
In pi√π ci aggiungo che √® curato pochissimo, pieno di bug e glitch davvero spaventosi e addirittura invalidanti.

Perch√© dovrei consigliare un gioco simile, senza nessuno spunto interessante, senza eventi davvero godibili e dove non succede NULLA per 2 ore, quando ci sono HL e OF che durano il triplo ed il doppio del tempo e sono belli il quintuplo?
Un gioco inutile e che non aggiunge nulla di nulla alla storia principale.
E voi potreste pensare che anche OF non aggiunga nulla alla storia, siccome √® in realt√† una storia separata. Ed io vi dico si, avete ragione. Ma OF √® divertentissimo, spettacolare e interessante.
Questo √® aberrante.

PRO:
- La ""storia"" da un altro punto di vista
- Il gameplay √® sempre quello di HL...

CONTRO:
- ...seppur castrato e con meno armi
- Nessuna aggiunta
- Ritmo praticamente inesistente, senza davvero nulla di rilevante
- Per chi non ha apprezzato HL, non apprezzerete neanche questo. Ma anche se amate HL.
- Pieno di bug e glitch

Voto: 4,5

Si bien es un juego corto, no deja de ser una parte algo medular si se quiere entender parte de la historia, y al contrario de lo que mencion√≥ cierto pelotudo m√°s abajo, hay que entender el juego por lo que es, una expansi√≥n cuyos momentos claves nos expanden un poco m√°s la visi√≥n respecto a c√≥mo se establecieron ciertas cosas antes del incidente. Gordon We have a problem

Barney Calhoun escapes Black Mesa after the entire US Military and aliens from another freaking dimension get on his case for the sheer size of the bar tab he owes them.

Also, Gordon Freeman laughs at him for being locked out.

If you like old-style shooters and you like Half-Life, yeah I'd recommend Blue Shift.  It goes on sale for 99 cents which is dirt cheap too so it doesn't hurt to own. It's a nice Half-Life game but don't expect it to be as outstanding as base Half-Life 1 or Opposing Force is.

Compared to Half-Life 1 and the other two expansion packs (Opposing Force and Decay), Blue Shift is easily the weakest. You spend a lot of time fighting either soldiers or weaker enemy types, or listening to exposition like in Half-Life 2.  The reason for this is because Blue Shift was intended to be an exclusive for the Sega Dreamcast console port of Half-Life 1, so the design needed to be toned down for console controls.  The Deamcast port later got cancelled, so with the work they already had they figured it would be better to release it for PC instead than to not release it at all.  I'm not in love with Blue Shift but I'm glad they did make is available on PC, it's not bad.

Kƒ±sa bir ek paket olmasƒ±na raƒümen Half-Life'ƒ±n saƒülam mekanikleri sayesinde kendini oynattƒ±rƒ±yor ve g√∂ndermelerle birlikte hikayeyi ba≈üka bir a√ßƒ±dan g√ºzel bir ≈üekilde sunmayƒ± ba≈üarƒ±yor. ƒ∞ndirimlerde zaten 2 liraya d√º≈ü√ºyor 2-3 saatlik g√ºzel bir deneyim i√ßin alƒ±nabilir.

Despite being shorter and simpler than Half Life Opposing Force I enjoyed Blue Shift more so. Besides the awkward platforming levels on Xen I think this game manages to capture a charm reminiscent of the original Half Life. There were some confusing puzzles but they can be fun once you get the hang of them.

Overall a good experience with decent replayability, a good story and a good ending (no spoilers).

I don't actually like or hate this DLC. But this game is a storyteller of how it's feel to work in Black Mesa (Well, only for a few minute before the resonance cascade shit happen). But it's telling you that you are not an important role in this story, Gordon is important because he's a scientist that start this, Shepard is important because he's part of the army which oppose Black Mesa and Gordon, but Barney? He's a normal security guard, he was about to enjoy his life and get paid at work and then those aliens and army ruin it. 

I don't know what the purpose of this story was, is it being a side character? 

7/10 an unnecessary story or even game.

The nostalgia value sent shivvers down my old spine as I loaded up the game.. 
All those fond memories came flooding back and suddenly I was 16 again, without all the negative hormone effects of those days ;)
I bought the collection and I'm having a blast going through the old gem that is the classic Half-Life series.
Well worth every penny and every minute spent...

Unfortunately no new weapons or anything new from half life, but I think it's still very enterteining. It is like original half life but you play as Barney Calhoun who is trying to escape from black mesa after big accident, The game is easy, i had no problems playing it on hard first try. The downside is that the game has aged a bit, its short and had some glitches, but they weren't gamebreaking. I recommend this game, but it get it on sale (ussualy -80% or -90%) or just get it in a package.

Blue shift is essentially just half life:lite. It reuses almost everything from base half life. adds no weapons or enemies. Despite coming out after opposing force it is severely a lesser experience. The only new things in this are the few new models and the "HD texture/model pack" which if im being honest i rarely ever prefer over the base models. This expansion is also very VEEEEERY short. It's fine but not the best.
